<title level="1" pfs="">[Archon, Wheel](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2079)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Among the most terrifying archons to behold, and easily the most difficult for mortals to comprehend, is the wheel archon, so named for its appearance as a flying, armor-plated wheel of fire with eyes on each spoke. Wheel archons often serve as messengers or harbingers for the armies of heaven, as their stubborn, indomitable natures make them ill-suited for missions requiring diplomacy or tact. Indeed, they have a legendary intolerance and single-mindedness in the pursuit of the punishment of evil.

 Wheel archons can't tolerate deceit and easily see through lies. The sensation of this celestial being's divine eyes all fixing upon a single target is usually enough to encourage honesty, but when a wheel archon detects a falsehood, their righteous wrath takes over and they mete out punishment to sinners without quarter.

</column>

</column>

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 16">[Wheel Archon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2079)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="LG" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Archon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=13" />
<trait label="Celestial" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=23" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #183: Field of Maidens](/Sources.aspx?ID=145) pg. 82</row>

**Perception** +28; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [_discern lies_](/Spells.aspx?ID=74), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Languages**
[Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19); [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +31, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +30, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +29, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +28, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +29

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +9

**Con** +6

**Int** +5

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +3
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 41 

**Fort** +26 

**Ref** +31 

**Will** +28 

+1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)
</row>

**HP** 230

**Weaknesses**
evil 15

**All-Knowing Eyes** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 34 Will save. If the creature fails, any [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) check it attempts until the end of its next turn has its result reduced by one degree of success. On a failed saving throw, a creature that is currently disguised or in a shape other than its true form also becomes [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) until the end of its next turn.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** fly 50 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
slam +30 ([Good](/Traits.aspx?ID=83), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 3d12+14 bludgeoning plus 1d6 good

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tongue of flame +33 ([Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Good](/Traits.aspx?ID=83), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 3d4+8 fire plus 1d6 good

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 37, attack +29
- **7th**
[Divine Decree](/Spells.aspx?ID=82), [Flame Strike](/Spells.aspx?ID=120), [Prying Eye](/Spells.aspx?ID=239), [Zealous Conviction](/Spells.aspx?ID=378)
- **8th**
[Antimagic Field](/Spells.aspx?ID=14), [Divine Wrath](/Spells.aspx?ID=86)
- **Constant (8th)**
[Discern Lies](/Spells.aspx?ID=74), [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344), [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340)

**Fiery Spokes** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Good](/Traits.aspx?ID=83)) The wheel archon spins furiously, emitting a rain of divine fire. All creatures in a 60-foot emanation take 12d6 fire damage and 5d6 good damage (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The wheel archon can't use Fiery Spokes for 1d4 rounds.

**Focus Gaze** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) The wheel archon fixes its gaze on a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a DC 37 Will save against the wheel archon's all-knowing eyes. If the creature is under any magical effect that disguises it or has altered its shape, the wheel archon attempts to counter that magical disguise effect ([counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) +29, 8th level). After attempting its save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the wheel archon's next turn.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Unforgiving Archons</title>

More so than other archons, the wheel archon's view of good and evil is rigid, almost to the point of absolute inflexibility. They carry out other celestials' instructions to the letter—sometimes in ways that incur grave consequences when they're faced with situations that would be served better with moderation and forgiveness. A wheel archon never regrets or feels remorse for their actions, as they see themself as an arbiter of heavenly law.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-9" />
